question.body: The amount of each type of muscle fiber that a person has is in part determined by their genetic make-up. This genetic make up differs from person to person. For example you would expect someone who is really good at sprinting to have a high percentage of what type of fiber?

response.feedback: Incorrect. You would expect to find SO fibers in a long distance runner because they provide less explosive energy but take longer to fatigue.
Correct. You would expect to find FG fibers because they provide short bursts of high tension contractions good for sprinting.
Incorrect. FO fibers have characteristics that are in between the other types of fibers and do not supply the same burst of high tension as FG fibers would.

part.hint: This fiber must produce a lot of tension fast.

question.body: If this person wanted to increase the efficiency of their FG fibers what type of exercises would they want to do?

response.feedback: Correct. Anaerobic because FG fibers need a fast source of energy and do not have time for aerobic respiration to happen.
Incorrect. Aerobic excises will increase the SO fibers.

part.hint: FG fibers do not require as much oxygen as SO fibers.
